intro: Rourea oddonii, commonly known as the golden tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, golden-yellow foliage. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often hidden among the leaves. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
